adjective.description: Of or relating to Richard Cameron, his followers, or his religious beliefs. Now historical.
British Army. Of or belonging to the Cameronian Regiment. Now historical.

noun.description: A supporter or follower of Richard Cameron or his religious beliefs; (informal) a member of the body subsequently known as the Reformed Presbyterian Church of Scotland. Now chiefly historical.
British Army. In plural = Cameronian Regiment. Now historical.

origin: Late 17th century; earliest use found in untitled. From the name of Richard Cameron, Scottish Covenanter and field preacher + -ian.
